sen.j: 桃山駅（ももやまえき）は、京都府京都市伏見区桃山町鍋島34番地にある、西日本旅客鉄道（JR西日本）奈良線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Located at 34 Nabeshima, Momoyama-cho, Fushimi Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, Momoyama Station is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Momoyama Station, located at 34 Nabeshima, Momoyama-cho, Fushimi Ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line, a West Japan Railway Company (JR-West) Line.
Momoyama Station, located at 34 Nabeshima, Momoyama-cho, Fushimi ward of Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture, is a stop on the Nara Line of West Japan Railway Company (JR West).

sen.j: JRの特定都区市内制度における「京都市内」の駅である。
sen.e: It is a station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.
It is a station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.
It is a station situated within 'Kyoto Municipality' in accordance with JR's Specific Ward Municipal System.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station layout
Station layout
Station layout

sen.j: 単式・島式複合型2面3線のプラットホームを持つ、交換設備を備えた地上駅。
sen.e: It is an above ground station with a complex configuration of two platforms, one a single-sided platform (track on one side only) and the other an Island platform with tracks on both sides, a total of three tracks where trains can pass each other or pass others.

It is an above-ground station with a complex configuration of two platforms, one a single-sided platform (track on one side only) and the other an island platform with tracks on both sides, for a total of three tracks where trains can pass each other or pass others.

It is an above-ground station with a complex configuration of two platforms, one a single-sided platform (track on one side only) and the other an island platform with tracks on both sides, for a total of three tracks where trains can pass each other or pass others.

sen.j: 永らく無人駅の状態が続いていたが、近年7：30～19：50に限りジェイアール西日本交通サービスの女性駅員が常駐している。
sen.e: The station remained unmanned for a long time, but between 07:30-19:50 in recent years, a female employee of JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd. is on duty as station staff.
The station remained unmanned for a long time, but between 07:30-19:50 in recent years a female employee of JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd. is on duty as station staff.
The station remained unmanned for a long time, but between 07:30-19:50 in recent years a female employee of JR West Japan Transportation Service Co., Ltd. is on duty as station staff.

sen.j: ICOCA・Jスルー利用可能駅。
sen.e: ICOCA and J Through Cards can be used at this station.
ICOCA and J Through cards can be used at this station.
ICOCA and J-Thru cards can be used at this station.

sen.j: ICOCAの相互利用対象であるPiTaPa（スルッとKANSAI協議会）も利用可能。
sen.e: J Through Cards (Surutto Kansai Association) whick are to subject to mutual use with ICOCA Cars can also be used.
J Through cards (Surutto Kansai Association) which are to subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards can also be used.
J-Thru cards (Surutto KANSAI Association) which are to subject to mutual use with ICOCA cards can also be used.

sen.j: 線路が高速運転に対応しておらず、快速列車などが通過する際は、かなりの減速（35km/h制限）を強いられる駅でもある。
sen.e: As railway tracks are not high-speed compatible, rapid trains and others are forced to slow down quite a bit (speed limit 35km/h) when they pass this station.
sen.cmt: "快速列車など"は不適で、"などの高速列車"であれば理解可能と思われます。
sen.e: As the railway tracks are not high-speed compatible, rapid trains and others are forced to slow down quite a bit (speed limit 35km/h) when they pass this station.
As the railway tracks are not high-speed compatible, rapid trains and others are forced to slow down quite a bit (speed limit 35 km/h) when they pass this station.
sen.cmt: 35 km/hとしました（スペース追加）。

sen.j: また、駅の北側の線路は国道24号線と住宅が立ち並ぶ丘陵地に挟まれており、奈良線の複線化計画を進行させる際に複線化用地を捻出するのが困難な状態となっている。
sen.e: Tracks on the northern side of the station are laid between National Highway Route No.24 and a hilly area where many houses have been built creating a situation difficult to find means and ways to come up with sufficient land when advancing the Nara Line Double Track Project.

The tracks on the northern side of the station are laid between National Highway Route No. 24 and a hilly area where many houses have been built, creating a situation that makes it difficult to find the means to come up with sufficient land when advancing the Nara Line Double Track Project.

The tracks on the northern side of the station are laid between National Route 24 and a hilly area where many houses have been built, creating a situation that makes it difficult to find the means to come up with sufficient land when advancing the Nara Line Double Track Project.

sen.j: 駅本屋側単式ホームが1番線、跨線橋を渡って反対側の島式ホームが2・3番線。
sen.e: Track #1 platform is the single-sided one nearer the main station building and platform for Tracks #2 and #3 is the one on the opposite side crossing an overpass and is of Island type.
The track No. 1 platform is the single-sided one nearer the main station building and platform for track nos. 2 and 3 is the one on the opposite side crossing an overpass and is of the island type.
Platform 1 is the single-sided one nearer the main station building, and Platform 2 and 3 are the ones of the island type on the opposite side crossing an overpass.

sen.j: 2番線は通常は京都方面通過列車が通過するだけのホームではあるが、団体臨時列車が運転される際には京都方面列車が2番線停車に変更されることが多い（団体臨時列車は1番線に停車）。
sen.e: Track #2 platform is normally a platform along which nonstop trains bound for Kyoto pass, but converted to where trains bound for Kyoto stop when special group trains are operated (group trains stop on Track #1.)

The track No. 2 platform is normally a platform along which nonstop trains bound for Kyoto pass, but it's converted to where trains bound for Kyoto stop when special group trains are operated (group trains stop on track No. 1.)

Platform 2 is normally a platform along which nonstop trains bound for Kyoto pass, but it's converted to where trains bound for Kyoto stop when special group trains are operated (group trains stop on Platform 1.)

sen.j: また、1番線を使用しての折返しおよび後続列車退避が可能な信号配置になっており、かつては正月ダイヤ実施時に京都～桃山の区間運転列車も存在した。
sen.e: Track #1is used for shuttle operation and is where a special signal is installed for a train to take refuge from the following train and there were times in the past when trains shuttled between Kyoto and Momoyama stations under a New Years' timetable then in effect.

Track No. 1is used for shuttle operation and is where a special signal is installed for a train to take refuge from the following train, and there were times in the past when trains shuttled between Kyoto and Momoyama stations under a New Years' timetable then in effect.

Platform 1 is used for shuttle operation and is where a special signal is installed for a train to take refuge from the following train, and there were times in the past when trains shuttled between Kyoto and Momoyama stations under a New Years' timetable then in effect.

sen.j: 貨物営業を行っていた当時は、伏見産の日本酒の輸送にも使われていた。
sen.e: In the days when the freight line was being operated, Japanese liquor (Sake) of Fushimi produce was also an item which was transported.
In the days when the freight line was being operated, Japanese liquor (sake) of Fushimi produce was also an item that was transported.
In the days when the freight line was being operated, Japanese liquor (sake) of Fushimi produce was also an item that was transported.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization status
Utilization status
Usage status
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2006年度の1日あたりの乗車人員は約1,732人である。
sen.e: Passengers getting on at this station averaged 1,731 per day in fiscal 2006.
sen.cmt: "約"は合理性をもたせるために"平均"としました。
sen.e: Passengers getting on at this station averaged 1,731 per day in fiscal 2006.
The number of passengers boarding at this station came to approximately 1,732 per day in fiscal year 2006.

sen.j: （京都府統計書より）
sen.e: （Source:Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
（Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)
（Source: Kyoto Prefecture Statistical Report)

sen.j: 駅周辺
sen.e: Station surroundings
Station surroundings
Station surroundings

sen.j: 少し離れてはいるが、西に近鉄京都線の桃山御陵前駅、京阪本線の伏見桃山駅、南には京阪宇治線の観月橋駅がある。
sen.e: A short distance away to the west are Momoyama Gyro-mae Station (Kintetsu Kyoto Line) and Fushi-Momoyama Station (Keihan Main Line,) and to the south、 Kangetsu-bashi Station (Keihan Uji Line.)
A short distance to the west are Momoyama Gyro-mae Station (Kintetsu Kyoto Line) and Fushi-Momoyama Station (Keihan Main Line) and to the south is Kangetsu-bashi Station (Keihan Uji Line).
A short distance to the west are Momoyama Goryo-mae Station (Kintetsu Kyoto Line) and Fushimi-Momoyama Station (Keihan Main Line) and to the south is Kangetsukyo Station (Keihan Uji Line).
sen.cmt: Goryo, Fushimi, Kangetsukyo と修正しました。

sen.j: いずれも徒歩10分前後で乗り換えが可能である。
sen.e: Transferring to any of them is possible by a walk of about 10 min.
Transferring to any of them is possible with a walk of approximately 10 minutes.
Transferring to any of them is possible with a walk of approximately 10 minutes.

sen.j: 伏見桃山陵
sen.e: Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Meiji
Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Meiji
Fushimi-Momoyama-no-Misasagi (Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Meiji)
sen.cmt: 日本名を追加しました。

sen.j: この駅が一番の最寄り駅。
sen.e: This station is the nearest station.
This is the nearest station.
This is the nearest station.

sen.j: 明治天皇の陵墓。
sen.e: Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Meiji.
The Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Meiji
It is the Imperial Mausoleum of Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 奉葬にあわせ桃山駅の改装も行われた。
sen.e: Momoyama Station renovated coinciding with the Imperial funeral.
Momoyama Station was renovated to coincide with the Emperor's funeral.
Momoyama Station was renovated to coincide with the Emperor's funeral.

sen.j: 参拝のため戦前には当駅発着のお召し列車が運転されたこともある。
sen.e: There were times in pre-WWII days when the Emperor's special train arrived at/departed from this station.
There were times in pre-WWII days when the Emperor's special train arrived at or departed from this station.
There were times in pre-WWII days when the Emperor's special train arrived at or departed from this station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 奈良鉄道の手で開業した当初、当駅から京都駅までは伏見駅 (京都府)経由のルートであったが、1921年の東海道本線の馬場（現・膳所駅）-京都間のルート変更に合わせ、同線旧ルートの稲荷駅-京都間を編入した現在のルートに切り替えられた。
sen.e: At the outset when inaugurated by Nara Railway, the route between this station and Kyoto Station was via Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture,) but coinciding with the change made to the route of Tokaido Main Line between Baba (now Zeze Station) and Kyoto Station in 1921, its former route between Inari Station and Kyoto was annexed and changed to the route as it is today.

At the outset, when inaugurated by Nara Railway, the route between this station and Kyoto Station was via Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture), but coinciding with the change made to the route of Tokaido Main Line between Baba (now Zeze Station) and Kyoto Station in 1921, the former route between Inari Station and Kyoto was annexed and changed to the route as it is today.

At the outset, when inaugurated by Nara Railway, the route between this station and Kyoto Station was via Fushimi Station (Kyoto Prefecture), but coinciding with the change made to the route of Tokaido Main Line between Baba (now Zeze Station) and Kyoto Station in 1921, the former route between Inari Station and Kyoto was annexed and changed to the route as it is today.

sen.j: なお、旧線の当駅-伏見間は暫く貨物線として存続していた。
sen.e: The section between this station and Fushimi on the former line existed for some time as a freight line.
The section between this station and Fushimi on the former line existed for some time as a freight line.
The section between this station and Fushimi on the former line existed for some time as a freight line.

sen.j: 1895年（明治28年）11月3日 - 奈良鉄道伏見-桃山間延伸に伴い、その終着駅として開業。
sen.e: Inaugurated on Nov. 3, 1895 as terminal station incidental to Nara Railway extending its operations to this station from Momoyama
It was inaugurated on Nov. 3, 1895 as a terminal station incidental to the Nara Railway, extending its operations to this station from Momoyama
November 3, 1895: The station was inaugurated as a terminal station incidental to the Nara Railway, extending its operations to this station from Momoyama.

sen.j: 1896年（明治29年）1月25日 - 当駅から玉水駅まで延伸。
sen.e: Extension works from this station to Tamashima Station completed on Jan. 25, 1896.
The extension work from this station to Tamashima Station was completed on Jan. 25, 1896.
January 25, 1896: The extension work from this station to Tamamizu Station was completed.
sen.cmt: Tamamizuに修正年表表記に統一

sen.j: 途中駅となる。
sen.e: This station became an intermediate station.
This station became an intermediate station.
This station became an intermediate station.

sen.j: 1905年（明治38年）2月7日 - 合併により関西鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a Kansei Railway station on Feb. 7, 1905 as a result of amalgamation.
It became a Kansei Railway station on Feb. 7, 1905 as a result of amalgamation.
February 7, 1905: The station became a Kansai Railway Company station as a result of amalgamation.
sen.cmt: Kansai としました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1907年（明治40年）10月1日 - 関西鉄道が鉄道国有法。
sen.e: Kansei Railway Company nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
Kansei Railway Company was nationalized on Oct. 1, 1907 under the Railway Nationalization Act.
October 1, 1907: Kansai Railway Company was nationalized under the Railway Nationalization Act.
sen.cmt: Kansai としました。年表表記に統一

sen.j: 1921年（大正10年）3月20日 - 稲荷-桃山間の新線が開業し奈良線ルート変更。
sen.e: New line between Inari and Momoyama inaugurated on March 20, 1921 and Nara Line rerouted.
The new line between Inari and Momoyama inaugurated on March 20, 1921, and the Nara Line was rerouted.
March 20, 1921: The new line between Inari and Momoyama inaugurated, and the Nara Line was rerouted.

sen.j: 旧線は当駅から伏見までのみ貨物支線として存続。
sen.e: The former section between this station and Fushimi Station continued to exist but only as a freight line.
The former section between this station and Fushimi Station continued to exist, but only as a freight line.
The former section between this station and Fushimi Station continued to exist, but only as a freight line.

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）9月3日 - 当駅から伏見駅までの貨物支線が廃止。
sen.e: Freight branch line from this station to Fushimi Station abolished on Sept. 3, 1928.
The freight branch line from this station to Fushimi Station was abolished on Sept. 3, 1928.
September 3, 1928: The freight branch line from this station to Fushimi Station was abolished.

sen.j: 1987年（昭和62年）4月1日 - 国鉄分割民営化により、JR西日本の駅となる。
sen.e: Became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from split privatization of Japan National Railways.
It became a JR-West station on April 1, 1987 from the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
April 1, 1987: The station became a JR West station due to the split privatization of Japan National Railways.
sen.cmt: JR Westとしました。年表表記に統一
